channel.title: rop on Civiled
channel.description: Recent content in rop on Civiled

item.title: Cyberspace 2024
item.description: Binary Manipulation I’m given a binary “chal” with the following protections: Arch: amd64-64-little RELRO: Partial RELRO Stack: Canary found NX: NX enabled PIE: No PIE (0x400000) Initially I held on to the assumption that shellcoding wouldn’t be possible due to NX being enabled. This would prove to be a problem later on. Luckily PIE was disabled so it’d be easy to setup debug scripts to break at static locations and I won’t have to rely on a memory leak if I want to begin with ROP.
